title: C3 Glomerulopathy - Dense Deposit Disease and C3 Glomerulonephritis
short_description: Clinical overview of C3 Glomerulopathy (C3G), a rare complement-mediated kidney disease encompassing Dense Deposit Disease (DDD) and C3 Glomerulonephritis (C3GN).
long_description: This document provides a comprehensive overview of C3 Glomerulopathy (C3G), a rare kidney disease classification established in 2013 that encompasses two subtypes: Dense Deposit Disease (DDD) and C3 Glomerulonephritis (C3GN). The text explains the evolution of disease nomenclature based on advances in understanding complement-mediated renal diseases, detailing the characteristic features of each subtype including their distinct electron microscopy findings and shared immunofluorescence patterns showing C3 protein abundance in renal glomeruli. The document covers epidemiological aspects, noting the disease affects all ages with varying prevalence between subtypes, and emphasizes that definitive diagnosis requires kidney biopsy with specific histological and microscopic examination criteria.
